title: I come Back after Three years.
body:
And somehow, it feels like the game is in even worse shape than before.

I just played as Vlad vs Fiona and got absolutely stomped. She had superior damage to me, superior mobility, superior survivability, and blocked my freakin ult.

It upsets me greatly because I remember when Vlad got his original nerfs way back when. iirc it was because "he had too much survivability for his damage capability" yet somehow it's just peachy that Fiona can do way more than old Vlad ever could.

Also, what is your issue with point and click skills? I've been looking at the skillsets for the more recent champions, and if anything we need ore auto target skills, not less.

I WANT to like this game, but you're making it really diffcult for me. All the champions I loved from three years ago cannot keep up with more recent releases.

replies.body:
well for starters you haven't played in 3 years, it's not a surprise you got shrekt.

Also it's the new thing, add healing or true damage to every single rework or new champion.
Shrekt x Fiona

> [{quoted}](name=SwapShadows,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:09:38.012+0000)
>
> well for starters you haven't played in 3 years, it's not a surprise you got shrekt.
> 
> Also it's the new thing, add healing or true damage to every single rework or new champion.

It's not even that I got stomped that upsets me so much. Its that Vlad got nerfed years ago and he couldn't even do half the things that Fionia was doing. Does Riot just have something against mage characters?

Vlad is either OP or UP, you can't have both. The game evolves and changes, and champions are gonna be weak/strong depending on the meta or the changes Riot directly makes. Nothing is the same for too long.

But Vlad's issue was that he rendered all poke useless while still putting out pretty good dps. He rarely had to leave lane. 

Granted, Fiora needs some tweaks, but saying Vlad didn't need nerfs isn't true.

> [{quoted}](name=Raccoon Kid,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:16:22.917+0000)
>
> It's not even that I got stomped that upsets me so much. Its that Vlad got nerfed years ago and he couldn't even do half the things that Fionia was doing. Does Riot just have something against mage characters?

it's almost like the company changes it's viewpoints as the years go by like everyone else

> [{quoted}](name=SwapShadows,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:09:38.012+0000)
>
> well for starters you haven't played in 3 years, it's not a surprise you got shrekt.
> 
> Also it's the new thing, add healing or true damage to every single rework or new champion.

True, {{champion:245}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:432}} all have some sort of healing...
Well... You can't count GP since he had that before his rework and Morde got healing because they nerfed his Q so it only provides a third of spell vamp since it'd be broken with vamp otherwise.
And what happens when every champion has been reworked?

Vlad into Fiora is a bad matchup in the first place. Also, Fiora has pathetic survivability outside of 1v1 scenarios, unless people are playing like the kind of retards that lose to Fizz because they threw everything at him within the same fraction of a second.

And what's actually wrong with more skill shots instead of targeted spells? The fact that you might have to aim for once, or that minions might actually be able to protect the champion?

There are some old champions that need work, but not many. Also, you came in right at the pre-season, so if you stick around, you'll see the Marksman update and Poppy rework.

> [{quoted}](name=JustMyBassCannon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:16:18.212+0000)
>
> Vlad into Fiora is a bad matchup in the first place. Also, Fiora has pathetic survivability outside of 1v1 scenarios, unless people are playing like the kind of retards that lose to Fizz because they threw everything at him within the same fraction of a second.
> 
> And what's actually wrong with more skill shots instead of targeted spells? The fact that you might have to aim for once, or that minions might actually be able to protect the champion?
> 
> There are some old champions that need work, but not many. Also, you came in right at the pre-season, so if you stick around, you'll see the Marksman update and Poppy rework.

The problem with 'skill'shots is that Mage champions are completely dependent on their abilities for damage, Having to manually aim immediately puts them at a severe disadvantage, add that with many new champions having a ton of mobility and you've basically made all the old mages worthless.

Could you imagine all the right click champions having to manually aim each swing/shot rather than it happen automatically?

I could.

Then again, I play ESO and grew up on Dungeon Siege.

And maybe that gives me a bias towards skill shots actually being fun and interesting, especially in an online competitive game.

"Also, what is your issue with point and click skills? I've been looking at the skillsets for the more recent champions, and if anything we need ore auto target skills, not less."

Why?

> [{quoted}](name=MotherTeresa1910,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-10-24T20:01:37.938+0000)
>
> "Also, what is your issue with point and click skills? I've been looking at the skillsets for the more recent champions, and if anything we need ore auto target skills, not less."
> 
> Why?

Because at the moment mobility champions absolutely wreck non-mobile champs. Having 'skill'shots as apposed to homing spells puts a massive handicap on certain champions. Something needs to be done that punishes high mobility champions.
And how would you know? You came back to play one game and hated it. You know absolutely nothing about the game. lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T20:24:10.767+0000)
>
> And how would you know? You came back to play one game and hated it. You know absolutely nothing about the game. lol.

I don't need to play the game over and over to know that a champion that is meant to kill doing zero damage is bad game design.

Except it wasn't you doing no damage, it was you building horrifically bad as well as you playing horribly. She got Merc Treads and you got 0 armor. You also never got a Hextec Revolver as Vlad... So you had nothing but health and AP against a champion who does % health damage. I mean, seriously... You know nothing about the game at all if you don't even get an Armguard or a Hextech Revolver against a Fiora.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=00050000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T20:41:59.158+0000)
>
> Except it wasn't you doing no damage, it was you building horrifically bad as well as you playing horribly. She got Merc Treads and you got 0 armor. You also never got a Hextec Revolver as Vlad... So you had nothing but health and AP against a champion who does % health damage. I mean, seriously... You know nothing about the game at all if you don't even get an Armguard or a Hextech Revolver against a Fiora.

We weren't even talking about my praticular match. you asked why does the game need more point and click skills, and I was saying that mages with nothing but skillshots are at a massive disadvantage.

If that were true, you'd have dominated with Vlad and got wrecked when playing Karthus. Karthus uses his Q as most of his damage, which is a skill shot and you were against a Yasuo who is incredibly mobile whereas the other game you were using Vlad who's only skill shot is his R and that's an insta-cast AoE and near impossible to dodge, so it's not much of a 'skillshot'.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T21:45:39.259+0000)
>
> If that were true, you'd have dominated with Vlad and got wrecked when playing Karthus. Karthus uses his Q as most of his damage, which is a skill shot and you were against a Yasuo who is incredibly mobile whereas the other game you were using Vlad who's only skill shot is his R and that's an insta-cast AoE and near impossible to dodge, so it's not much of a 'skillshot'.

Karthus Q is spammable. Secondly, in that match I was up against kennen, not samurai guy. Had it been samurai i would have gotten wrecked due to superior mobility. When I talked about skillshot nukes I was thinking veigar/zilean. Both of whom have no redeeming qualities at the moment.

Riot has indicated they want all mage champions to be like Veigar and Zil, in my eyes, thats them admitting they want mage champions to be worthless.
LOL. Veigar... worthless... Oh god. HAHAHAHA... Good lord, you're bad if you think one of the top banned champions is WORTHLESS, HAHAHAHA. Veigar has a near 50% ban rate in Plat+.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000500000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T23:16:29.804+0000)
>
> LOL. Veigar... worthless... Oh god. HAHAHAHA... Good lord, you're bad if you think one of the top banned champions is WORTHLESS, HAHAHAHA. Veigar has a near 50% ban rate in Plat+.

Can someone verify this?

> [{quoted}](name=Raccoon Kid,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T23:26:58.933+0000)
>
> Can someone verify this?

http://champion.gg/champion/Veigar

He's one of the best mid laners in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=NemeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=00050000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T23:36:36.810+0000)
>
> http://champion.gg/champion/Veigar
> 
> He's one of the best mid laners in the game.

So, a champion that dies if you fart on him hard, entire kit save his ult can be countered by moving slightly to the left... is a top pick... this game makes no sense to me
That what happens when you come back to a constantly changing game after 3 years.
Yeah, here's the [link](http://champion.gg/champion/Veigar/Middle). lol.

> I WANT to like this game, but you're making it really diffcult for me.

You have to understand that this is not the same game you played three years ago.  Things change, and those who can't adapt leave.  If you treat League of today as if it was still season 2 you will always be disappointed with how things are being handled, however if you look at it as it is rather than what it was it's significantly easier to be happy with it.

Older champions are slowly getting touchups to keep them competitive, however all can still be played if you're willing to put the time and energy into learning how.  Their play style has changed far more than their kits since you were last here, after all.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:19:42.148+0000)
>
> You have to understand that this is not the same game you played three years ago.  Things change, and those who can't adapt leave.  If you treat League of today as if it was still season 2 you will always be disappointed with how things are being handled, however if you look at it as it is rather than what it was it's significantly easier to be happy with it.
> 
> Older champions are slowly getting touchups to keep them competitive, however all can still be played if you're willing to put the time and energy into learning how.  Their play style has changed far more than their kits since you were last here, after all.

The issue is: what the game used to be is objectively superior to what it has become for anyone who doesn't like playing right click champions.

I played Veigar and was mortified to see that his Q was now a 'skill'shot. That is absolutely ridiculous, by simply moving you have the capability reduce Veigar's damage to zero, and what did he receive in return for this massive nerf? Not a single thing from what I saw.

> what the game used to be is objectively superior

This is where the problem is.  You think it's objective, when it's not.  It's all a matter of opinion here.  You prefer the game as it was.  If it was an objective matter or else people could be wrong if they prefer the game now, which would be silly.

Your opinion of what makes League good doesn't mesh well with what it currently is.  That is the problem here.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-10-24T19:56:17.816+0000)
>
> This is where the problem is.  You think it's objective, when it's not.  It's all a matter of opinion here.  You prefer the game as it was.  If it was an objective matter or else people could be wrong if they prefer the game now, which would be silly.
> 
> Your opinion of what makes League good doesn't mesh well with what it currently is.  That is the problem here.

Concistency > potential, all the time. By taking away reliable damage from a champion you essentially render it worthless.(this is why in WoW hit was always top priority for all damage specs)

You cannot justify skill shot mages being at such a huge disadvantage. Whats worse is that they receive absolutely nothing in return. 

Putting a handicap on a playable character in a competitive "just cause" is bad game design. THAT is objective.

Every single point you've made is subjective.  I'd love to talk about this with you as we need more people with strong opinions around here who are willing to do just that, but if you don't recognize the difference between what actually is objective and what is just subjective I don't think we'll actually be able to discuss anything.

Oh no, you picked a late game scaler against a strong laner with superior all-in potential.

Oh you let her reach late game?  You should've bullied her in lane to delay her scaling.

.... 

{{champion:114}}

> [{quoted}](name=Epjest,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-10-24T20:06:47.918+0000)
>
> Oh no, you picked a late game scaler against a strong laner with superior all-in potential.
> 
> Oh you let her reach late game?  You should've bullied her in lane to delay her scaling.
> 
> .... 
> 
> {{champion:114}}

This was not possible due to her high mobility.

You are playing a constantly changing game for the first time in 3 years, and you're assuming that you are just as good as you were before, and that you are just as knowledgeable as before. I'm sorry to break it to you, but things have changed, and if you don't look at it and learn, instead bitching about someone you lost to that you didn't understand (you probably let her hit every vital and tried to use all of your spells into Riposte), you're gonna get fucked. If I hadn't played football in 100 years, and had woke up from some sort of crazy coma to play it, I would be incredibly shocked at the game. You know, there's passing now, fast players are important, running isn't just ramming some guys into other guys, and people are paid millions of dollars to coach the teams. However, just getting pissed at it and complaining about how my 300 LB guys are getting steamrolled and how I'm getting outplayed at every turn would be just ignorant and dumb.

1: Riot didn't intentionally make the double TP meta and is planning to nerf it. 

2: Okay, this is a decent point, but doesn't give any actual good examples. 

3: Yeah because Bard was so fucking strong on release. 

4: Taric is getting a rework. Paying attention to the people you criticize is helpful sometimes.

As a long time Vlad player I would just like to point out.....

Compared to live values his early game has been BUFFED, release Vlad did less Q damage AND Q had a longer cooldown. 15 seconds vs today's 10. Also the Q's healing has gotten more reliable now that it is a fixed value as opposed to a percentage of damage done. Where the nerfs hurt are his late game where the damage has deceased, the cooldowns have increased, and his passive has gotten weaker.

Just saying that if you are going to nitpick on Vlad getting weaker looking at his early game probably isn't the best place to start.

On a final note Vlad has always had trouble with enemies that can easily close the gap on him, he relies on out trading his opponent so when they can force a flight or flight he generally loses in the early game. Fiora is good at getting in his face so I am not surprised you had issues. Vlad has less lane issues than he has had in the past although the previous counters still work just fine, I am sorry you went into a game facing one of them.

> [{quoted}](name=Narsicus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-10-25T01:51:44.837+0000)
>
> As a long time Vlad player I would just like to point out.....
> 
> Compared to live values his early game has been BUFFED, release Vlad did less Q damage AND Q had a longer cooldown. 15 seconds vs today's 10. Also the Q's healing has gotten more reliable now that it is a fixed value as opposed to a percentage of damage done. Where the nerfs hurt are his late game where the damage has deceased, the cooldowns have increased, and his passive has gotten weaker.
> 
> Just saying that if you are going to nitpick on Vlad getting weaker looking at his early game probably isn't the best place to start.
> 
> On a final note Vlad has always had trouble with enemies that can easily close the gap on him, he relies on out trading his opponent so when they can force a flight or flight he generally loses in the early game. Fiora is good at getting in his face so I am not surprised you had issues. Vlad has less lane issues than he has had in the past although the previous counters still work just fine, I am sorry you went into a game facing one of them.

Eh, I'm dropping Vlad. I'm having much more success with Malzahar. He seems to be the one mage thats capable of  actually punishing high mobility champs.
To bad you didnt play in april or july. Vlad was a terror around that time.

So you brought a range top & got lost by an actual melee top, Big deal.

I say justice is served.

> And somehow, it feels like the game is in even worse shape than before.

> I just played as Vlad vs **Fiona** and got absolutely stomped. She had superior damage to me, superior mobility, superior survivability, and blocked my freakin ult.

> It upsets me greatly because I remember when Vlad got his original nerfs way back when. iirc it was because "he had too much survivability for his damage capability" yet somehow it's just peachy that **Fiona** can do way more than old Vlad ever could.

> Also, what is your issue with point and click skills? I've been looking at the skillsets for the more recent champions, and if anything we need ore auto target skills, not less.

> I WANT to like this game, but you're making it really diffcult for me. All the champions I loved from three years ago cannot keep up with more recent releases.

And btw, it's FIORA, not Fiona.

http://i.memeful.com/memes/M0oPmyw.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2015-10-24T23:32:50.118+0000)
>
> So you brought a range top & got lost by an actual melee top, Big deal.
> 
> I say justice is served.
> 
> And btw, it's FIORA, not Fiona.
> 
> http://i.memeful.com/memes/M0oPmyw.jpg

huh.. with how much she was moving around you coulda fooled me with the whole melee thing.
Welcome to the League of Legends (which doesnt make sense anymore since the Intitute of war was retconned).
where legend says that the developers used to be on the same page, lore made sense, effort was expended to make the gameplay great and everyone had fun
Where everything's made up and the points don't matter!
Vlad relies on his abilities, fiora has sustained damage output. Vlad has one defense ability, which costs health. I wonder why you lost.

> [{quoted}](name=LadyRenly,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=NGWvi1ps,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-10-24T20:41:33.712+0000)
>
> Vlad relies on his abilities, fiora has sustained damage output. Vlad has one defense ability, which costs health. I wonder why you lost.

Yes, heroes that rely on their abilities are at a huge disadvantage to sustained damage heroes. Why is the game like that?
SKT just wrecked Origin's Fiore top with a Renekton. His CS was amazing and 2 large ganks killing him didn't remove Renektons 80 cs lead.

Fiora is gamebreakingly overpowered.
The game is in a FAR worse state than it was 3 years ago (season 2).
Actually that was when league cam closest to being balanced.

You complain about one game, after playing a reworked champ that you probably didn't know any of the new changes made. You likely complained about losing when you likely had no idea what the match up was like.
